channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2023120685
item.description:
Report X-2023120685

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: LAKE ORION
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver that had this package on his truck was out delivering when he discovered the leaking hazmat. He put the package in plastic bags to try to contain the spill. He promptly drove to back to the Fedex Ground station and alerted QA of the package. The driver pulled the package out causing some to spill on a few other packages in the truck. He set the package on the passenger side steps while QA investigated. One QA person called the emergency number who stated they could someone out to clean up or we could clean up if we felt we could handle it. QA placed the package in a red hazmat tote. QA sprinkled the area with neutralizing powder as a safety measure. The spill was soaked up and the clean up materials placed in the salvage drum. DescribePack: The top of the cap on the bottle has broken off. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red hazmat tote and put into a well ventilated area. Absorbent pads were placed on the area of the spill that appeared to be dry already. We sprinkled neutralizing powder on the area just in case. The steps of the truck where the hazmat had been placed were wet so we sprinkled the neutralizing powder there as well.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found on inbound shift and they performed the DPR. DescribePack: All 4 caps have a small hole in them. 1 out of 2 jugs of Rapicide PA Part A has it's cap seal broken and now leaks from the hole in the cap. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Inbound brought the package in a tote to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report I-2023120044
item.description:
Report I-2023120044

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/28/2023, during the cruise phase of flight, a passenger seated in 26E revealed to the Flight Attendant that his cell phone was sparking/overheating. The Flight Attendant placed the device in the fire containment bag utilizing water to mitigate the heat. The flight continued to DTW without further incident. The bag was given to DTW personnel upon arrival. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report I-2023120046
item.description:
Report I-2023120046

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-22T18:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: Troy
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Transportation Driver had to use 3 separate hose conections to deliver product into the customer's tank. When the driver pressurized the trailer a leak developed at the dry-mate connection on the second hose. The connection was leaking for approxiamately 5 minutes in duration before the operater on site notified the driver and the flow was turned off. Floor-dry was used by the customer to absorb the spilled product.

item.title: Report E-2023120198
item.description:
Report E-2023120198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-11
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock in Romulus, MI. The spill consisted of (1) 5 gallon plastic bucket of Plasite 7159 Part A (UN1263), which was punctured by a forklift blade during dock ops, causing 5 ounces to release. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they would clean the spill with absorbent and place the contents into a 10 gallon poly drum. The created waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.
